page.title: 12THE WORK OF A COALMAN
page.content: In Westhoughton many houses are still{heated by coal}as a lot of people still prefer an open fire.The coal is{delivered}to the houses by the coalman,who has a very dirty and tiring job.He needs to be dressed in{ {strong clothes and boots},and he wears a sleeveless leather overall across his back,to protect it from the sharp edges of the coal.The coal is delivered to the houses in{sacks}, which are emptied into{coal bunkers or {coal sheds}.The householder carries the coal into the house on a{shovel}. The coalman we interviewed has been working at the job for 7 years,and delivers coal to {300 houses}a day.
